author: Paul Hannon
title: ECB Takeaways: Few Concerns, No Changes
text:
The European Central Bank wasn’t expected to change its policies Thursday, and didn’t. But participants in financial markets were looking to Mario Draghi’s analysis of a first-quarter slowdown in economic growth for guidance as to what policy makers might do next.
Overall, Mr. Draghi signaled that the central bank hasn’t been thrown into a panic by the unexpected loss of momentum in the first three months of the year, but nor did he rule out the possibility that it was more than a blip.
...
